title: Sifting Spoon, ca. 1830–60
markings: On reverse of handle: stamped: Dutch fineness mark for  .833 used from 1814 to September 1, 1953; profile facing left and an ant signifying the French import mark from the decree of June 29, 1895. Also "PKR" with curve shape above letters.
description: Pointed oval bowl pierced with three stars and radiating trefoils within an alternating hourglass and egg border. The bowl with scalloped edge. The bifurcated stem issuing rounded, pointed terminal engraved with flower head within dot engraved border.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Sifting Spoon, ca. 1830–60.
ca. 1830–60. silver. Gift of Samuel P. Avery. 1903-1-30.
